non-contributory.
using a large french mercury bougie, polyvinyl bougie, or a balloon, esophageal dilatation is performed with the goal of fracturing the ringâ€”not merely stretching it.
focal constriction in the lower esophagus known as a schatzki's ring just above a sliding hiatal hernia.

peristaltic wave (if not witnessed in real time)
history of 3 months of worsening dysphagia and reflux.
